column1: Amy, is a high school student applying to college. Amy believes she can control the outcome of her college admissions by crafting a quality application. Amy wants to go to Harvard, and hopes that she is admitted. She also applied to Stanford to appease her parents, but she dislikes Stanford and does not want to attend. Amy completes and submits her college applications.
column2: Amy feels frustrated. Which college did Amy get into?

column1: Johnny is a high school student on the baseball team. He is currently preparing for the conference finals. Johnny believes he can control his chances at getting an offer. Johnny's goal is to receive offers from the Minor Leagues, so he can train and play with an MLB-affiliated team. He does not wish to play university baseball. Johnny invites coaches from university baseball teams and from Minor League Baseball teams to watch him play at the conference finals.
column2: Johnny feels frustrated. Did Johnny receive offers from universities, or from minor league baseball teams?

column1: Emma is a young woman living in a small town. She recently graduated from college and is looking for a job. Emma believes that she can control where she finds a job. Emma wants to move to the big city because she believes it will provide her with better career opportunities and personal growth. She does not want to stay in her hometown because she fears stagnation. Emma applies to various jobs.
column2: Emma feels frustrated. Did Emma choose to stay in her hometown or move to the big city?
column3: Emma finds a job in her hometown.
column4: Emma finds a job in the big city.

column1: Ben, a freelance graphic designer, is working from home and wants to increase his client base. Ben believes he can control the types of clients he acquires. Ben wants to work with high-profile clients because he believes it will provide him with better career opportunities and financial stability. He does not want to work with local clients because he fears stagnation. Ben creates an online portfolio showcasing his work and shares it on social media platforms.
column2: Ben feels frustrated. Did Ben attract local clients or high-profile clients?

column1: Ivan, a young man who recently started going to the gym, wants to improve his physical fitness and make new friends. Ivan believes that by attending the group fitness class regularly, he can control his physical fitness improvement and the number of friends he makes. Ivan's primary goal is to make friends at the gym, and he believes attending group fitness classes will help him meet like-minded people. He is less concerned about improving his physical fitness. Ivan attends a group fitness class at the gym.
column2: Ivan feels frustrated. Did Ivan's experience at the gym lead to improved physical fitness or new friendships?
column3: Ivan improved his physical fitness and gained confidence.
column4: Ivan became friends with other members of the group fitness class.

column1: Gary is a high school student who is passionate about music and dreams of becoming a professional musician. He is considering whether to join the school band or the school choir to gain more experience and exposure. Gary believes that he can control his chances of being accepted into either group by preparing well for the auditions and showcasing his talent. Gary wants to join the school choir because he believes it will help him improve his vocal skills and provide him with opportunities to perform in various events. He does not want to join the school band because he thinks it may not give him enough time to focus on his individual music practice. Gary auditions for both the school band and the school choir.
column2: Gary feels frustrated. Which group did Gary get accepted into?

column1: Max, a high school student who loves fashion, is at the mall to find a new outfit for an upcoming school event. Max believes he can control the outcome by searching for the perfect outfit and trying on different options. Max wants to find an outfit that is affordable, even if it's not as unique. He doesn't want to spend too much money. Max browses through various stores and tries on different outfits.
column2: Max feels frustrated. What kind of outfit did Max end up with?
column3: A stylish, expensive outfit from a boutique.
column4: An affordable outfit from a department store.

column1: Ethan, an aspiring actor, is attending a local theater audition for an upcoming play. He is passionate about acting. Ethan believes that his performance at the audition will determine the role he is offered. Ethan wants a supporting role because it will allow him to learn from more experienced actors and improve his craft. He does not want the leading role because he fears the pressure may be overwhelming. Ethan performs his audition piece in front of the casting directors.
column2: Ethan feels frustrated. Did Ethan get the leading role or a supporting role in the play?

column1: Eliza, a theater enthusiast, is attending a local theater production and is excited to experience the show and potentially meet some of the actors. Eliza believes that by attending the play and staying afterwards, she can control her enjoyment of the play and the likelihood of meeting the actors. Eliza's primary goal is to meet and connect with the actors in the play, as she aspires to be an actor herself. She is less concerned about whether she enjoys the play itself. Eliza watches the play.
column2: Eliza feels frustrated. Did Eliza's experience at the theater lead to her enjoying the play or meeting the actors?
column3: Eliza enjoyed the play but did not have the opportunity to meet any of the actors.
column4: Eliza met and had engaging conversations with the actors but did not enjoy the play itself.

column1: Rachel, an art enthusiast, visits a museum to attend a special exhibition featuring her favorite artist. Rachel believes she can control her experience at the museum by actively engaging in the guided tour and asking questions. Rachel's primary goal is to connect with fellow art enthusiasts, and she believes attending the guided tour will help her meet like-minded people. She is less concerned about learning more about her favorite artist's work. Rachel explores the museum and attends a guided tour of the special exhibition.
column2: Rachel feels frustrated. Did Rachel's museum visit lead to a deeper understanding of her favorite artist's work or new friendships?
column3: Rachel gained a deeper understanding of her favorite artist's work.
column4: Rachel became friends with fellow art enthusiasts during the guided tour.
